task.title: Create SRX File
task.shortdesc: Create an SRX file that can be used for segmenting documents by translation tools that support SRX 2.0.

step.cmd: In the File menu, select New File or click the button.
Click the Add Language Rule button to display the Language Rule dialog.
In the Language Rule Name text box, enter a meaningful name for the language rule.
In the Language Pattern text box, enter a regular expression to indicate the languages supported by the new rule.
Click the Accept button to add the language rule.
step.stepresult: The new language rule appears in the Language Rules table of the editor.

step.cmd: Follow these steps as many times as necessary to populate the language rule with segmentation rules:

substep.cmd: Click the Add Rule button to display the Rule Editor dialog.
Select the Breaks Segment check box if the new segmentation rule breaks text. Leave it unselected otherwise.
In the Before Break text box, enter a regular expression that describes the text that appears before the break point or break exception.
In the After Break text box, enter a regular expression that describes the text that appears after the break point or break exception.
Click the Accept button to add the new segmentation rule.
substep.stepresult: The new rule appears in the Rules table of the editor.

step.cmd: In the File menu, select Save File or click the button to specify a file name for the SRX file and save it.

taskbody.result: A new SRX 2.0 file is generated and saved under the selected name.
